protocol.name: Exana
protocol.description: Exana is a cross-chain DeFi protocol focused on optimized liquidity management and MEV protection

exana_swap.name: ExanaSwap
exana_swap.description: MEV-protected decentralized exchange with optimized routing

exana_yield.name: ExanaYield
exana_yield.description: Automated yield aggregator with dynamic strategy adjustment
features: Impermanent loss protection for long-term LPs

exana_shield.name: ExanaShield
exana_shield.description: DeFi insurance protection for Exana users

faqs.question: What makes Exana different from other DeFi protocols?
faqs.answer: Exana differentiates itself through MEV protection at the protocol level, cross-chain optimization, and dynamic strategy adjustment based on market conditions. Our focus is on maximizing returns while minimizing risks like impermanent loss and sandwich attacks.

faqs.question: Is Exana safe to use?
faqs.answer: Exana prioritizes security through multiple independent audits, a $1M bug bounty program, and $40M in insurance coverage. All protocol upgrades undergo rigorous testing and community review via our governance process.

faqs.question: How does Exana governance work?
faqs.answer: EXANA token holders can propose and vote on protocol changes through our on-chain governance system. Proposal submission requires holding at least 25,000 EXANA tokens or receiving delegation from holders with that amount. Voting power is proportional to token holdings.

faqs.question: What chains does Exana support?
faqs.answer: Exana currently supports Ethereum, Arbitrum, Optimism, and Base, with plans to expand to Polygon and Avalanche in Q3 2024.

faqs.question: How can I earn yields on Exana?
faqs.answer: Users can earn yields by providing liquidity to ExanaSwap pools, staking EXANA tokens, or depositing assets into ExanaYield strategies. Current APYs range from 8% to 30% depending on the asset and strategy chosen.

Release ExanaYield v2 with improved auto-compounding
Q3_2024: Launch ExanaSwap v3 with concentrated liquidity
